question: Which team does Walt Allen play for?

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Walt Allen's NCAA Division I Legacy Confirmed**

In a stunning revelation, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that Walt Allen, a former college basketball standout, indeed played in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league. According to records obtained from Presbyterian College, where Allen suited up from 2008 to 2011, the talented athlete was an integral part of the Blue Hose men's basketball team. During his tenure, Allen consistently demonstrated exceptional skills on the court, earning him recognition among his peers and coaches alike. "Walt was an incredible asset to our team," said Gregg Nibert, Presbyterian College's head men's basketball coach during Allen's playing days. "His work ethic, athleticism, and dedication to the sport made him a valuable contributor to our program. We're proud to have had him represent our institution in the NCAA Division I." A review of NCAA records confirms that Presbyterian College is, in fact, a member institution of the NCAA Division I, with its men's basketball team competing in the Big South Conference. This affiliation solidifies Allen's participation in the top-tier collegiate basketball league. Data from Sports-Reference.com, a reputable source for sports statistics, further corroborates Allen's NCAA Division I credentials. The website lists Allen as a player for Presbyterian College during the 2008-2009, 2009-2010, and 2010-2011 seasons, with detailed statistics on his performance in each campaign. When asked about his experience playing in the NCAA Division I, Allen humbly reflected, "It was an incredible honor to compete at the highest level of college basketball. The competition, the atmosphere, and the camaraderie with my teammates – it was an unforgettable experience that shaped me into the person I am today." In light of these findings, it is clear that Walt Allen's claim to have played in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league is substantiated by credible sources, data, and expert testimony. His legacy as a talented college basketball player is now a matter of public record, cementing his place in the annals of NCAA Division I history.
content.source_2:
**COLLEGE HOOPS STAR MACKENZIE LEAHY TAKES THE COURT BY STORM**

In the world of NCAA Division I men's basketball, few players have made a splash as quickly as Mackenzie Leahy. The talented college athlete has been dominating the court since her freshman year, leaving fans and coaches alike in awe of her skills. Leahy, a standout player for Brown University, has been making waves in the Ivy League with her impressive stats and clutch performances. In a recent interview, Leahy attributed her success to her tireless work ethic and dedication to the sport. "I've always been driven to be the best version of myself on and off the court," Leahy said. "I put in the extra hours in the gym, and it's paid off. My teammates and coaches have been incredibly supportive, and I'm grateful to be a part of this program." Leahy's numbers speak for themselves. She's currently averaging 18.5 points per game, with a shooting percentage of 45.2% from beyond the arc. Her impressive stats have earned her a spot on the Ivy League's All-Conference Team, and she's being touted as a top contender for the league's Player of the Year award. "Mackenzie is a game-changer," said Brown University head coach, Mike Martin. "She's got the heart of a lion and the skills to match. We're lucky to have her on our team, and I have no doubt she'll continue to make us proud." Leahy's impact extends beyond the court, too. She's become a role model for young athletes across the country, inspiring countless girls and women to pursue their passion for basketball. "I'm humbled by the attention, but I know I'm not just playing for myself," Leahy said. "I'm playing for all the girls who come from small towns and big cities, who dream of making it to the top. I want to show them that it's possible, that they can achieve their goals with hard work and determination." As the NCAA tournament approaches, all eyes will be on Leahy and her Brown University teammates. With her talent, drive, and dedication, there's no telling how far she'll take her team – or how high she'll soar in the world of college basketball.

answer: Presbyterian College Blue Hose men's basketball team
